channel.title: Tor Browser 8.0a9
channel.description:
Tor Browser 8.0a9 -- based on Firefox 60.1 ESR -- works in Whonix. Nice.
Fixed:
-> Nice green onion for onion services -> Whonix landing page is back! -> We finally have sandboxing for Tor Browser! But, "user namespaces" is a "no" under the Sandbox section of about:support - Whonix or other issue? -> Everything seems functional e.g. New Identity etc. -> Works with Firejail & AppArmor profiles, but tons of AppArmor denied msgs now -> check.torproject.org strangely says:
> Congratulations. This browser is configured to use Tor. > > Your IP address appears to be: XX.XX.XX.XXX > > However, it does not appear to be Tor Browser. > Click here to go to the download page.
[quote="torjunkie, post:752, topic:3477"] Ah that Tor Browser check is now a known issue over at torproject.org.
https://trac.torproject.org/projects/tor/ticket/26566
So just the native sandbox issue is of interest (although Fingerprint is probably horrible now that header spoofing is not done by Tor Browser + ESR 60.1 standing out + not many users until September’s transition of default users). [/quote]
Why not full sandboxing in Whonix (as is the case in normal VMs e.g. Firefox in Fedora 28)?

item.title: Tor Browser 8.0a9
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
iry:

It seems this commit has not been pushed into the Whonix repository, causing the GPG verification failure when downloading 8.0a9 with tb-updater.

https://github.com/Whonix/tb-updater/commit/64436d0bad01971cee833a16991eec2f7606b5b1

//cc @Patrick

This should be sorted in all Whonix 14 repos.

Read full topic

It seems this commit has not been pushed into the Whonix repository, causing the GPG verification failure when downloading 8.0a9 with tb-updater.

update tbb signing key with new sub keys 

Thanks to @pgerber for the heads up!
closes https://github.com/Whonix/tb-updater/pull/6

changed 1 files with 2089 additions and 499 deletions.

item.title: Tor Browser 8.0a9
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
The new sandbox support is for Windows. Linux TBB sandboxing is dead and disabled for builds as of 2 weeks ago.

https://blog.torproject.org/comment/275955#comment-275955
https://trac.torproject.org/projects/tor/ticket/25540

Read full topic

item.title: Tor Browser 8.0a9
item.dc:creator: torjunkie
item.description:
Tor Browser 8.0a9 – based on Firefox 60.1 ESR – works in Whonix. Nice.

Fixed:

-> Nice green onion for onion services
-> Whonix landing page is back!
-> We finally have sandboxing for Tor Browser! But, “user namespaces” is a “no” under the Sandbox section of about:support - Whonix or other issue?
-> Everything seems functional e.g. New Identity etc.
-> Works with Firejail & AppArmor profiles, but tons of AppArmor denied msgs now
-> check.torproject.org strangely says:

Congratulations. This browser is configured to use Tor.

Your IP address appears to be: XX.XX.XX.XXX

However, it does not appear to be Tor Browser.
Click here to go to the download page.

Long Wiki Edits Thread

Ah that Tor Browser check is now a known issue over at torproject.org.

https://trac.torproject.org/projects/tor/ticket/26566

So just the native sandbox issue is of interest (although Fingerprint is probably horrible now that header spoofing is not done by Tor Browser + ESR 60.1 standing out + not many users until September’s transition of default users).

Why not full sandboxing in Whonix (as is the case in normal VMs e.g. Firefox in Fedora 28)?

Read full topic
